condition.narrative: Annual Work Plans and Budgets: By no later than one (1) month after the Effective Date under the Grant Agreement, prepare a draftwork plan and budget for Project implementation, setting forth, inter alia: (i) a detailed description of the planned activities,including any proposed conferences and training, under the Project for the period covered by the plan; (ii) the sources andproposed use of funds therefor; (iii) procurement and environmental and social safeguards arrangements therefor, as applicable and;(iv) responsibility for the execution of said Project activities, budgets, start and completion dates, outputs and monitoringindicators to track progress of each activity. (Section I.B (2) (a) of Schedule 2).

Project Implementation Manual: The recipient shall no later than thirty (30) days after the Effective Date of the Grant Agreement,prepare a Project Implementation Manual containing detailed arrangements and procedures for implementation of the Project includinginter alia: (A) administration and coordination; (B) monitoring and evaluation; (C) financial management, procurement andaccounting procedures (D) environmental and social risks management; (E) corruption and fraud mitigation measures; (F) a grievanceredress mechanism; (G) Personal Data collection and processing in accordance with applicable national law and good internationalpractice; (H) roles and responsibilities for Project implementation; and (I) and such other arrangements and procedures as shall berequired for the effective implementation of the Project. (Section I.B (1) (i) of Schedule 2).

title.narrative: Cumulative number of targeted hospitals whose isolation and/or ICU facility has been upgraded
Cumulative number of targeted hospitals whose laboratory spaces have been remodeled/upgraded
Cumulative number of laboratory tests done for suspected COVID-19 cases
Proportion of targeted hospitals with functional oxygen delivery equipment
Proportion of targeted Regional Referral Hospitals with clinical capacity to manage COVID-19 cases in line with clinical guidelines
Cumulative number of staff trained in laboratory diagnosis of SARS-CoV-2 and other important pathogens
Proportion of RRHs enrolled on the LQMS scoring >90% in the annual biowaste management audits
Cumulative number of laboratories enrolled on ISO 15189 accreditation maintaining or achieving ISO 15189 accreditation
Proportion of people travelling through the targeted designated PoEs screened
Proportion of COVID-19 suspected cases, having laboratory confirmation within 72 hours
Proportion of Grievances captured in the Complaints Register for UCREPP that have been “CLOSED OUT” in accordance with GRM under the Project
Cumulative number of staff trained in critical and acute medical care
